version_description:
The most advanced way to learn a language is here. Now available for both iPhone and iPad!

Introducing Bots, the first AI-powered way to practice conversation in a new language. From grabbing a slice of pizza to hailing a taxi, Bots will prepare you for real-life conversation—minus the awkwardness. No more fear of making mistakes. Or being judged. Or sounding weird.

For now, Bots are available for the Spanish, French, and German courses.

Introducing Duolingo Clubs! Team up to learn a language with your friends. It's like having gym buddies, but for your brain!

* Prove that you're hot stuff by maintaining 1st place — caliente!
* Congratulate friends in your new language and blind them with your brilliance 
* Taunt them as they strive to keep up with you (futile!)
* Make everyone feel things by exchanging custom emojis
* Choose from badges so cute, you’ll want them tattooed

As gym-goers know, teaming up to reach a goal can take you from Dad bod to demigod. 

Ready to learn a language in 2017? Let 'em find you in da Club — this time, with less 50 Cent.

Announcing the launch of the Japanese course for English speakers, the most requested course in Duolingo’s five-year history!

- Learn to speak Japanese and read all three of its writing systems: Hiragana, Katakana and basic Kanji
- Get ready for the 2020 Tokyo Olympics with a special bonus skill
- Learn all of the vocabulary and grammar needed to pass JLPT N5, the most popular Japanese language proficiency test in the world.

You may already be curious about the culture behind the world’s third largest economy, sushi, haikus, karate, Zen, and Pokemon. Once you start learning Japanese, you’ll realize that’s just the beginning.

Various bug fixes and perf—OMG WE JUST LAUNCHED A CHINESE COURSE.

The new Chinese course includes:
- 1000+ words,
- bonus lessons on internet slang, festivals and business communication
- a brand new exercise to teach tones (yes, tones!)
- all of the words and grammar from the HSK1-3 and some from HSK 4. The HSK is China's standardized exam for Chinese fluency.

Bug fixes and performance improvements.

BEHOLD! Introducing the biggest redesign of Duolingo courses since, well, ever: Crown Levels!

- A LOT more learning content in every course!
- Skills can now be "leveled up" 5x to reach harder exercises. Each level introduces more advanced vocabulary and phrasings to teach you more than ever before.
- All your previous progress still counts, there is just a lot more to learn now.
- No more struggle to keep your skills "golden". Complete a level, earn a Crown, and keep it!
- Brand-new exercise types in some courses.
- Fluency score is no more! We instead bestow you with Crowns - a measure of your overall progress in each course.

Crown Levels add lots of new content to learn. Here are a couple of tips for making the most out of it:

- You don't have to finish all of the Levels in a skill! Bored with the basics? Find harder content in Levels 3-5 of Skills farther down the tree.
- Running out of Health? Earn it back using the Practice button on the Health tab to brush up on weaker words.

Two new feature alerts:

1. Hear, hear! We've added a brand-new "listen-and-tap" exercise type for all courses, where you listen to a phrase and then tap the corresponding words from the word bank below. These exercises will be shown at earlier levels of each course so you can get a head start on improving your listening comprehension skills.

2. We’ve got some ’splainin' to do - you asked for more explanation around grammar and pronunciation, so we’re adding exactly that! Tap the new Tips icon next to certain skills to get in-depth explanations of key concepts. We’ll be adding more every week, starting with our Spanish, French and Chinese courses.

For more Duolingo news, contests and product releases, follow us on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram @duolingo.

While we're fixing bugs and improving performance, check out 3 of our cool new features:

1. Test out of skills: With the new "Test Out" buttons, you can skip content you already know and focus on the good stuff.

2. Don't lose that streak: Did you know you get 1 free streak repair each month with a Duolingo Plus subscription?

3. Check out a Duolingo Event: Want to practice your language skills in real life? Attend a Duolingo Event in your city and practice with other awesome Duolingo learners. Learn more at events.duolingo.com.

New and improved Spanish and French courses are now available for most users! We’re always working to improve how well Duolingo teaches, and these new courses are a major step forward in getting you to a higher level of proficiency. The Spanish and French courses now have 800 new words each and dozens of illustrated tips on grammar, pronunciation, and common phrases.

We understand this change may appear to cause a loss of progress for some advanced users, but we’re really just adding a lot more new content to learn! More details coming to our blog this week: making.duolingo.com

Know that feeling when you get to Level 5 of a skill and see it turn gold? Feels great, but as you advance, it’s easy to forget previous material.

So we’re reintroducing spaced repetition to help reinforce what you’ve learned. When it’s time to review concepts, Level 5 skills will “crack”. Doing a practice lesson will restore the skill to its fully gilded glory!

For the learning science nerds: spaced repetition means you revisit information regularly at set intervals over time. It’s a simple concept but highly effective for learning new things – like languages!
